i Default Approval Value G&G
On the underwriting issue approval page, the default approval value is calculated
based on the values of

« Value Comparator
* DefaultValueAssignmentType
+ DefaultValueOffsetAmount

Value Comparator At most (monetary) New Approval
Default Value Offset Percentage Val
Assignment Type alue

r
Default Value Offset 10 At most (monetary) 220000.00
Amount

Default Approval value = UWlssue.value + Default Value Offset Amount * UWlssue.value

Configure authority profiles and
assign them to users

i Authority grants and authority profiles

¢ An Authority grant allows a user to approve a specific issue
* Issue types with values can have a limit or “any” for approval
« Authority grants are added to authority profiles

¢ An Authority profile determine the types of underwriting issues that a user can
approve

¢ Authority profiles often contain multiple authority grants
¢ Multiple profiles allow fine-grained control

« Job-level, “Underwriter 1”

+ Expertise, “Farm Equipment”

+ Incremental, “Joe’s Special”

i Configure authority grants

¢ Create authority profiles with authority grants
¢ Administration > Users & Security > Authority Profiles
¢ Assign authority profiles to users
¢ Administration > Users & Security > User > UW Authority

Question G

ae What is an authority grant?
4
¢

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer G

ae What is an authority grant?
4
¢

Authority grants allow users to approve a specific issue defined in UW Rule.

SS Se ee eee eo

Question G

ae What is an authority profile?
4
¢

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer G

ae What is an authority profile?
4
¢

Authority profiles are collections of authority grants and can be assigned to users.

SS Se ee eee eo

i Demonstration G

— Configure authority profiles to approve
a underwriting issue
click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.
